Original: As you disembark from the skyship,
you step into a new maze.
[Page]
This one is a misty forest whose tall
trees grow in clusters.
[Page]
You begin walking through the misty
labyrinth, appreciating its tranquil
atmosphere.
Translation: As you disembark from the skyship,
you step into a new maze.
[Page]
This one is a misty forest whose tall
trees grow in clusters.
[Page]
You begin walking through the misty
labyrinth, appreciating its tranquil
atmosphere.

Original: As you walk through the dense forest,
you stop momentarily. Is that singing
you hear from the south...?
[Page]
At first, it seems to be a trick of
the wind, but you listen closer and
know that you are not hearing things.
[Page]
Could it be another party of explorers
up ahead? What awaits you there...?
Translation: As you walk through the dense forest,
you stop momentarily. Is that singing
you hear from the south...?
[Page]
At first, it seems to be a trick of
the wind, but you listen closer and
know that you are not hearing things.
[Page]
Could it be another party of explorers
up ahead? What awaits you there...?

Original: You reach an open clearing without
any trees. A woman is here with her
back to you. You cannot see her face.
[Page]
Small, firefly-like lights float
silently around her.
[Page]
It is she who sings the song that
drew you here.
[Page]
The tune she hums, oblivious to your
presence, is wordless.
[Page]
You are unsure of what to do now that
you have found her, though addressing
her is always an option.
Translation: You reach an open clearing without
any trees. A woman is here with her
back to you. You cannot see her face.
[Page]
Small, firefly-like lights float
silently around her.
[Page]
It is she who sings the song that
drew you here.
[Page]
The tune she hums, oblivious to your
presence, is wordless.
[Page]
You are unsure of what to do now that
you have found her, though addressing
her is always an option.

Original: [Color:5]Talk to her?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Talk to her?[Color:0]

Original: When you call to her from behind, she
flinches and spins to face you.
[Page]
The lights floating around her
abruptly dissipate.
Translation: When you call to her from behind, she
flinches and spins to face you.
[Page]
The lights floating around her
abruptly dissipate.

Original: You decide to leave her be and simply
enjoy her song. It is quiet and
exquisite, with a hint of loneliness.
[Page]
Eventually, it ends. The lights that
had been floating around her seem to
have dissipated.
[Page]
She gives a small sigh, stands, and
happens to look your way.
Translation: You decide to leave her be and simply
enjoy her song. It is quiet and
exquisite, with a hint of loneliness.
[Page]
Eventually, it ends. The lights that
had been floating around her seem to
have dissipated.
[Page]
She gives a small sigh, stands, and
happens to look your way.

Original: "Huh...?" The woman, or perhaps "girl"
would be more appropriate, stares at
you with widened eyes.
[Page]
Her mouth opens and closes, but she
seems unable to find the right words
to express her shock.
[Page]
In an attempt to break the ice, you
address her, but it seems to frighten
her and she takes a step back.
Translation: "Huh...?" The woman, or perhaps "girl"
would be more appropriate, stares at
you with widened eyes.
[Page]
Her mouth opens and closes, but she
seems unable to find the right words
to express her shock.
[Page]
In an attempt to break the ice, you
address her, but it seems to frighten
her and she takes a step back.

Original: Suddenly, as if reacting to her
movement, something darts out from
the nearby brush!
[Page]
Its unearthly form looks like a shadow
in the shape of a woman. Seeing it,
the girl gasps.
[Page]
"What is a [Color:5]Hollow[Color:0] doing here!? Back!
S-Stay back!"
[Page]
But the shadow ignores the girl and
draws ever closer. You unsheathe your
weapons to confront the enemy!
Translation: Suddenly, as if reacting to her
movement, something darts out from
the nearby brush!
[Page]
Its unearthly form looks like a shadow
in the shape of a woman. Seeing it,
the girl gasps.
[Page]
"What is a [Color:5]Hollow[Color:0] doing here!? Back!
S-Stay back!"
[Page]
But the shadow ignores the girl and
draws ever closer. You unsheathe your
weapons to confront the enemy!

Original: After managing to slay the unfamiliar
enemy, you turn toward the young girl.
[Page]
She had been struck dumb during the
battle, but now that it is over, she
hastily bows to you.
Translation: After managing to slay the unfamiliar
enemy, you turn toward the young girl.
[Page]
She had been struck dumb during the
battle, but now that it is over, she
hastily bows to you.

Original: "I thank you for saving me. I hope
that none of you were hurt..."
[Page]
You tell the girl you are no worse
for wear and she smiles with relief.
"I am glad to hear it. Well done.
[Page]
"Not to be rude, but... are you
humans as well?" the girl asks
with restrained curiosity.
[Page]
"I regret cringing to see you. But...
Yggdrasil spoke truly. I was told that
if I waited here, humans would come!"
[Page]
She seems too excited to realize the
import of her own words...
[Page]
She made reference to Yggdrasil
speaking... What could this mean?
[Page]
"I'm known as the [Color:5]Medium[Color:0] in town.
And what are you called?"
Translation: "I thank you for saving me. I hope
that none of you were hurt..."
[Page]
You tell the girl you are no worse
for wear and she smiles with relief.
"I am glad to hear it. Well done.
[Page]
"Not to be rude, but... are you
humans as well?" the girl asks
with restrained curiosity.
[Page]
"I regret cringing to see you. But...
Yggdrasil spoke truly. I was told that
if I waited here, humans would come!"
[Page]
She seems too excited to realize the
import of her own words...
[Page]
She made reference to Yggdrasil
speaking... What could this mean?
[Page]
"I'm known as the [Color:5]Medium[Color:0] in town.
And what are you called?"

Original: Your party introduces themselves to
the girl, each in turn.
[Page]
The girl's wariness has subsided and
her eyes are bright as she questions
you. She seems to be opening up...
[Page]
But the conversation comes to a
crashing halt as a woman rushes in
from the south, staff in hand.
[Page]
"You...! Get away from the Medium!"
Translation: Your party introduces themselves to
the girl, each in turn.
[Page]
The girl's wariness has subsided and
her eyes are bright as she questions
you. She seems to be opening up...
[Page]
But the conversation comes to a
crashing halt as a woman rushes in
from the south, staff in hand.
[Page]
"You...! Get away from the Medium!"

Original: You recognize the woman. She is the
one who called herself Wufan, who
saved you in the Miasma Forest.
[Page]
"It appears my faith in humanity that
led me to save you was a mistake. To
think that you would come here...
[Page]
"And you dare address the Medium!
This is a disgrace... I shall banish
you from this place myself!"
[Page]
She seems ready and eager to attack!
But the girl quickly steps in between
you and the angry woman.
Translation: You recognize the woman. She is the
one who called herself Wufan, who
saved you in the Miasma Forest.
[Page]
"It appears my faith in humanity that
led me to save you was a mistake. To
think that you would come here...
[Page]
"And you dare address the Medium!
This is a disgrace... I shall banish
you from this place myself!"
[Page]
She seems ready and eager to attack!
But the girl quickly steps in between
you and the angry woman.

Original: "Wufan, wait! These people...
Guild [Guild] saved me from
the Hollows.
[Page]
"And look! They're just like me!
They're human too! How splendid!
[Page]
"I want to talk to them some more.
Can't I, please?"
[Page]
Wufan knits her brow and tries to
dissuade the girl, but eventually
sighs at her stubbornness.
Translation: "Wufan, wait! These people...
Guild [Guild] saved me from
the Hollows.
[Page]
"And look! They're just like me!
They're human too! How splendid!
[Page]
"I want to talk to them some more.
Can't I, please?"
[Page]
Wufan knits her brow and tries to
dissuade the girl, but eventually
sighs at her stubbornness.

Original: "If you must. But please, continue
your conversation inside the town
walls.
[Page]
"There is no precedent for Hollows
appearing in such a shallow stratum,
but we must be vigilant."
[Page]
You assume that the shadowy creatures
you fought a moment ago were these
Hollows. Wufan turns toward you...
[Page]
"...I trust you overheard. We will
wait for you in [Color:5]Vessel Town[Color:0], which
stands just down this path.
[Page]
"What the Medium wants, she gets.
I will prepare a reward for you. The
path is winding, so don't go astray."
[Page]
Wufan sternly takes the Medium's hand
and turns her back to you as she
begins walking away.
Translation: "If you must. But please, continue
your conversation inside the town
walls.
[Page]
"There is no precedent for Hollows
appearing in such a shallow stratum,
but we must be vigilant."
[Page]
You assume that the shadowy creatures
you fought a moment ago were these
Hollows. Wufan turns toward you...
[Page]
"...I trust you overheard. We will
wait for you in [Color:5]Vessel Town[Color:0], which
stands just down this path.
[Page]
"What the Medium wants, she gets.
I will prepare a reward for you. The
path is winding, so don't go astray."
[Page]
Wufan sternly takes the Medium's hand
and turns her back to you as she
begins walking away.

Original: "Ow... Hey! What's gotten into you?
I'm sorry, everyone, Wufan usually
isn't like this.
[Page]
"I have to go with her. We will be at
Vessel Town, so please be sure to
visit. I shall be waiting!"
Translation: "Ow... Hey! What's gotten into you?
I'm sorry, everyone, Wufan usually
isn't like this.
[Page]
"I have to go with her. We will be at
Vessel Town, so please be sure to
visit. I shall be waiting!"

Original: With that, Wufan drags the girl away.
Is there indeed a town this deep in
the labyrinth...?
[Page]
If so, it could be a very important
discovery...
Translation: With that, Wufan drags the girl away.
Is there indeed a town this deep in
the labyrinth...?
[Page]
If so, it could be a very important
discovery...

Original: After opening the door, you are met
with tall, wooden structures.
Translation: After opening the door, you are met
with tall, wooden structures.

Original: You would never have guessed when
viewing the area from above that these
were here... They must be well hidden.
[Page]
Could this be the Vessel Town that
the Medium spoke of?
Translation: You would never have guessed when
viewing the area from above that these
were here... They must be well hidden.
[Page]
Could this be the Vessel Town that
the Medium spoke of?

Original: "Humans...!? What business do you
have in our town!?"
[Page]
The man standing by the gate raises
his voice in alarm. You note that his
arms and hands are abnormally thin.
[Page]
He must be a Vessel himself. With
astonishing speed, he reaches for
the quiver on his back.
[Page]
Fortunately for all, a small figure
rushes in to stop him. It is the girl
you met in the forest.
Translation: "Humans...!? What business do you
have in our town!?"
[Page]
The man standing by the gate raises
his voice in alarm. You note that his
arms and hands are abnormally thin.
[Page]
He must be a Vessel himself. With
astonishing speed, he reaches for
the quiver on his back.
[Page]
Fortunately for all, a small figure
rushes in to stop him. It is the girl
you met in the forest.

Original: "Hold! Do not hurt them!"
[Page]
She intervenes between the Vessel on
guard and your party.
Translation: "Hold! Do not hurt them!"
[Page]
She intervenes between the Vessel on
guard and your party.

Original: "Did Wufan not mention it? These are
the ones who saved me in the forest.
They are my guests.
[Page]
"I am sorry... Did you run into any
difficulties on your way? I am happy
to see you. We have a meal prepared!"
Translation: "Did Wufan not mention it? These are
the ones who saved me in the forest.
They are my guests.
[Page]
"I am sorry... Did you run into any
difficulties on your way? I am happy
to see you. We have a meal prepared!"

Original: The girl takes your hand and leads you
further into town.
[Page]
The Vessel soldier lowers his readied
bow, but he seems unconvinced.
[Page]
You see scarcely anyone else on the
open roads. Could they all be in
hiding...?
Translation: The girl takes your hand and leads you
further into town.
[Page]
The Vessel soldier lowers his readied
bow, but he seems unconvinced.
[Page]
You see scarcely anyone else on the
open roads. Could they all be in
hiding...?

Original: The ones you do see from time to time
are all Vessels. There is not one
other human in the whole town.
[Page]
The Vessels glare at you coldly;
some speak to each other in hushed
whispers.
[Page]
When you look uneasily at the Medium,
her eyes are downcast with shame.
Translation: The ones you do see from time to time
are all Vessels. There is not one
other human in the whole town.
[Page]
The Vessels glare at you coldly;
some speak to each other in hushed
whispers.
[Page]
When you look uneasily at the Medium,
her eyes are downcast with shame.

Original: "Er... I think they are only surprised
to see you. Come, sit! Sit!"
[Page]
She smiles at you, but it does not
reach her eyes.
[Page]
The girl retrieves a bowl filled with
fruit and seeds and offers it to you
to eat...
[Page]
"How did you come here? What sorts of
things do you do normally? And what
kind of food do you prefer?"
[Page]
The questions come one after another
in a cheerful barrage.
[Page]
But you wonder if the ingenue act is
deliberate... You interrupt to ask if
there are any other humans here.
[Page]
"No, I am the only one," she says.
"I have no mother or father. Until
today, I thought I was unique.
[Page]
"I heard that the rest of humanity
disappeared long ago... but it seems
there are things Wufan doesn't know.
[Page]
"Are the others like us? How many
humans would you say there are where
you come from?"
[Page]
You hesitate before answering. You
want to give her the truth, but are
not sure how she would react...
Translation: "Er... I think they are only surprised
to see you. Come, sit! Sit!"
[Page]
She smiles at you, but it does not
reach her eyes.
[Page]
The girl retrieves a bowl filled with
fruit and seeds and offers it to you
to eat...
[Page]
"How did you come here? What sorts of
things do you do normally? And what
kind of food do you prefer?"
[Page]
The questions come one after another
in a cheerful barrage.
[Page]
But you wonder if the ingenue act is
deliberate... You interrupt to ask if
there are any other humans here.
[Page]
"No, I am the only one," she says.
"I have no mother or father. Until
today, I thought I was unique.
[Page]
"I heard that the rest of humanity
disappeared long ago... but it seems
there are things Wufan doesn't know.
[Page]
"Are the others like us? How many
humans would you say there are where
you come from?"
[Page]
You hesitate before answering. You
want to give her the truth, but are
not sure how she would react...

Original: [Color:5]Tell her truthfully?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Tell her truthfully?[Color:0]

Original: You tell the Medium about Tharsis and
the many other cities in the world
far beyond it.
[Page]
She is shocked to hear of an entire
world she has never seen. Her eyes go
soft as she loses herself in reverie.
[Page]
It is the first time you can recall
her youth showing through since you
arrived in this town.
[Page]
"That's amazing... you've come so far
to get here. I wish I could see the
places you've been."
[Page]
Her words are off the cuff and
genuine, but a cold voice spoils
her delight.
[Page]
"Medium. You must not listen to what
these humans tell you."
[Page]
The Vessel called Wufan approaches.
You are not certain how long she had
been listening.
Translation: You tell the Medium about Tharsis and
the many other cities in the world
far beyond it.
[Page]
She is shocked to hear of an entire
world she has never seen. Her eyes go
soft as she loses herself in reverie.
[Page]
It is the first time you can recall
her youth showing through since you
arrived in this town.
[Page]
"That's amazing... you've come so far
to get here. I wish I could see the
places you've been."
[Page]
Her words are off the cuff and
genuine, but a cold voice spoils
her delight.
[Page]
"Medium. You must not listen to what
these humans tell you."
[Page]
The Vessel called Wufan approaches.
You are not certain how long she had
been listening.

Original: To tell her about a world she may
never get to see would be cruel.
You decide to change the subject.
[Page]
"I wonder if I'll ever have the chance
to leave this town... I'm not as
strong as your guild, I'm afraid."
[Page]
The girl's shoulders sag. As you try
to think of a suitable reply, a sharp
voice interjects.
[Page]
"That is out of the question, Medium.
The outside world is festering with
impurities.
[Page]
"Only this town is worthy of
your gift.
[Page]
The Vessel called Wufan approaches.
You are not certain how long she had
been listening.
Translation: To tell her about a world she may
never get to see would be cruel.
You decide to change the subject.
[Page]
"I wonder if I'll ever have the chance
to leave this town... I'm not as
strong as your guild, I'm afraid."
[Page]
The girl's shoulders sag. As you try
to think of a suitable reply, a sharp
voice interjects.
[Page]
"That is out of the question, Medium.
The outside world is festering with
impurities.
[Page]
"Only this town is worthy of
your gift.
[Page]
The Vessel called Wufan approaches.
You are not certain how long she had
been listening.

Original: "Humans. I take it that you know
nothing of what happened in these
lands long ago.
[Page]
"Since I doubt you will return empty-
handed, I will tell of the legend.
And then you will leave at once."
Translation: "Humans. I take it that you know
nothing of what happened in these
lands long ago.
[Page]
"Since I doubt you will return empty-
handed, I will tell of the legend.
And then you will leave at once."

Original: The Medium starts to protest, but
Wufan pays her no heed and quietly
tells the tale.
[Page]
Once, it seems, many humans lived at
the foot of Yggdrasil and created
other races to take care of it.
[Page]
The Vessels were among these.
[Page]
For a time, there was peace, and
all lived under the blessings of
Yggdrasil. But then, one day...
[Page]
A Titan as tall as the heavens came
and hid Yggdrasil. Its blessings
were lost, along with many lives.
[Page]
The humans fled in terror of the
Titan, but the Vessels worked
together to slay the monster.
[Page]
And thus did Yggdrasil return to the
world. The Vessels worship it and
live in its lands to this day.
Translation: The Medium starts to protest, but
Wufan pays her no heed and quietly
tells the tale.
[Page]
Once, it seems, many humans lived at
the foot of Yggdrasil and created
other races to take care of it.
[Page]
The Vessels were among these.
[Page]
For a time, there was peace, and
all lived under the blessings of
Yggdrasil. But then, one day...
[Page]
A Titan as tall as the heavens came
and hid Yggdrasil. Its blessings
were lost, along with many lives.
[Page]
The humans fled in terror of the
Titan, but the Vessels worked
together to slay the monster.
[Page]
And thus did Yggdrasil return to the
world. The Vessels worship it and
live in its lands to this day.

Original: "...The Medium is human, but she is
not like the cowards who fled from
the Titan," sneers Wufan.
[Page]
"She is the one true human with
oracular powers... She alone can
hear Yggdrasil's voice.
[Page]
"Yggdrasil speaks through the Medium
to this day to direct we Vessels.
She is human, but nothing like you.
[Page]
"I thank you for protecting her, but
we cannot forgive your ancestors for
turning their backs on the Titan.
[Page]
"Here is your reward. As you are
skilled in combat, you may find it
useful. But never return here."
[Page]
With that, Wufan hands you an
old book.
Translation: "...The Medium is human, but she is
not like the cowards who fled from
the Titan," sneers Wufan.
[Page]
"She is the one true human with
oracular powers... She alone can
hear Yggdrasil's voice.
[Page]
"Yggdrasil speaks through the Medium
to this day to direct we Vessels.
She is human, but nothing like you.
[Page]
"I thank you for protecting her, but
we cannot forgive your ancestors for
turning their backs on the Titan.
[Page]
"Here is your reward. As you are
skilled in combat, you may find it
useful. But never return here."
[Page]
With that, Wufan hands you an
old book.

Original: Just then, she draws near and whispers
into your ear.
[Page]
"Why did the Medium choose you to
open up to...? You will not take her
from here. She is happier with us!"
[Page]
The burning hatred in her eyes is
unmistakable...
Translation: Just then, she draws near and whispers
into your ear.
[Page]
"Why did the Medium choose you to
open up to...? You will not take her
from here. She is happier with us!"
[Page]
The burning hatred in her eyes is
unmistakable...

Original: Wufan is with you every step of the
way out of town.
[Page]
"Why would you treat them so horribly?
I am human, too! They are no different
than me!"
[Page]
The Medium's protest against your
shabby treatment can be heard even
outside the town.
[Page]
Your investigation of the Misty Ravine
has taken an unexpected turn...
[Page]
Regardless of the Vessels' animosity,
you cannot stay silent about what
you have seen and heard today.
[Page]
Once you return to Tharsis, [Color:5]the
Outland Count must know about this[Color:0]
at once.
Translation: Wufan is with you every step of the
way out of town.
[Page]
"Why would you treat them so horribly?
I am human, too! They are no different
than me!"
[Page]
The Medium's protest against your
shabby treatment can be heard even
outside the town.
[Page]
Your investigation of the Misty Ravine
has taken an unexpected turn...
[Page]
Regardless of the Vessels' animosity,
you cannot stay silent about what
you have seen and heard today.
[Page]
Once you return to Tharsis, [Color:5]the
Outland Count must know about this[Color:0]
at once.

Original: You have reached Vessel Town. You
briefly consider entering, but you
doubt Wufan will meet with you.
[Page]
You will not improve the situation
by lingering here. You should return
to Tharsis and inform the Count.
Translation: You have reached Vessel Town. You
briefly consider entering, but you
doubt Wufan will meet with you.
[Page]
You will not improve the situation
by lingering here. You should return
to Tharsis and inform the Count.

Original: Upon visiting Vessel Town, you are
reunited with Wufan.
[Page]
If you wish, you can invite Wufan
into your guild.
Translation: Upon visiting Vessel Town, you are
reunited with Wufan.
[Page]
If you wish, you can invite Wufan
into your guild.

Original: [Color:5]Invite Wufan into your guild?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Invite Wufan into your guild?[Color:0]

Original: [Color:3]Wufan is now a registered member
of your guild.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]Wufan is now a registered member
of your guild.[Color:0]

Original: [Color:3]If you wish to put Wufan into your
party, go to the Explorers Guild
and select "Formation."[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]If you wish to put Wufan into your
party, go to the Explorers Guild
and select "Formation."[Color:0]

Original: [Color:3]Your guild is too full to register
a new member.[Color:0]
[Page]
[Color:3]If you would still like to register
Wufan in your guild, make space for
her and return here.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]Your guild is too full to register
a new member.[Color:0]
[Page]
[Color:3]If you would still like to register
Wufan in your guild, make space for
her and return here.[Color:0]

Original: As you proceed through the misty
maze, you encounter a flustered
soldier, looking around.
Translation: As you proceed through the misty
maze, you encounter a flustered
soldier, looking around.

Original: When he notices you, he rushes to
your side like a drowning man
clutching at a life preserver.
[Page]
"Finally! Another human! I'm saved...!
Do you happen to know where I could
find the exit?
[Page]
"This bizarre labyrinth has rendered
my map useless. I'm at a complete
loss..."
[Page]
You open up your map and point out to
him the location of the exit.
Translation: When he notices you, he rushes to
your side like a drowning man
clutching at a life preserver.
[Page]
"Finally! Another human! I'm saved...!
Do you happen to know where I could
find the exit?
[Page]
"This bizarre labyrinth has rendered
my map useless. I'm at a complete
loss..."
[Page]
You open up your map and point out to
him the location of the exit.

Original: "THANK you! Now I can get back to
Tharsis and prepare myself better."
Translation: "THANK you! Now I can get back to
Tharsis and prepare myself better."

Original: The soldier heads toward the location
you pinpointed for him... You decide
to resume your journey as well.
Translation: The soldier heads toward the location
you pinpointed for him... You decide
to resume your journey as well.

Original: As you are about to head out into the
labyrinth, a familiar-looking soldier
calls to you.
Translation: As you are about to head out into the
labyrinth, a familiar-looking soldier
calls to you.

Original: "Ho there. Staying safe, I hope? You
saved my life that time, you know.
I was waiting here to thank you.
[Page]
"Had you not shown up when you did,
I shudder to think of what could have
become of me. Thank you!"
[Page]
With that, the soldier hands you
a medicine bottle.
Translation: "Ho there. Staying safe, I hope? You
saved my life that time, you know.
I was waiting here to thank you.
[Page]
"Had you not shown up when you did,
I shudder to think of what could have
become of me. Thank you!"
[Page]
With that, the soldier hands you
a medicine bottle.

Original: You nod and return to your search.
The soldier sees you off, still
waving cheerfully.
Translation: You nod and return to your search.
The soldier sees you off, still
waving cheerfully.

Original: As you reach a fork in the road,
you suddenly hear someone yelling
after you.
Translation: As you reach a fork in the road,
you suddenly hear someone yelling
after you.

Original: "Hey! That was a mean-spirited trick
you played! I went to the place you
told me to, but there was no exit!
[Page]
"Thanks to you, I've been wandering
this whole time!" The fuming soldier
is the man who asked directions...
[Page]
"Come on, be straight this time and
tell me where the exit is!"
[Page]
You open up your map and point out to
him the location of the exit.
Translation: "Hey! That was a mean-spirited trick
you played! I went to the place you
told me to, but there was no exit!
[Page]
"Thanks to you, I've been wandering
this whole time!" The fuming soldier
is the man who asked directions...
[Page]
"Come on, be straight this time and
tell me where the exit is!"
[Page]
You open up your map and point out to
him the location of the exit.

Original: "And you're sure this time, right!?"
The soldier leaves in a huff.
Translation: "And you're sure this time, right!?"
The soldier leaves in a huff.

Original: When you enter the open area, you
discover a soldier collapsed on the
floor, covered in moth scales!
[Page]
You hurry to his side, but he is long
gone... He must have been swarmed by
moths...
[Page]
You take it to heart as something that
could happen to you, and resolve to
be especially cautious on your way.
Translation: When you enter the open area, you
discover a soldier collapsed on the
floor, covered in moth scales!
[Page]
You hurry to his side, but he is long
gone... He must have been swarmed by
moths...
[Page]
You take it to heart as something that
could happen to you, and resolve to
be especially cautious on your way.

Original: As you walk the calm forest path,
the mist hanging in the air, you
eventually come to a dead end.
[Page]
It may be a good spot to take a few
minutes' rest to enjoy the clean air
and rich scent of the local flora.
Translation: As you walk the calm forest path,
the mist hanging in the air, you
eventually come to a dead end.
[Page]
It may be a good spot to take a few
minutes' rest to enjoy the clean air
and rich scent of the local flora.

Original: [Color:5]Take a deep breath?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Take a deep breath?[Color:0]

Original: You inhale a lungful of the heady air
before returning to your search with
lightened steps.
Translation: You inhale a lungful of the heady air
before returning to your search with
lightened steps.

Original: [Color:3]The party recovers 10 TP.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]The party recovers 10 TP.[Color:0]

Original: You decide to leave this place in
order to take up your wanderings
once more.
Translation: You decide to leave this place in
order to take up your wanderings
once more.

Original: As you proceed down the animal trail,
covered in a morning haze, you are met
with a bizarre sight up ahead.
[Page]
There are large, silent shadows in
thick fog, shouldering a rainbow-
colored halo...
[Page]
The eerie shadows frighten you and sap
some of your enthusiasm for further
exploration.
Translation: As you proceed down the animal trail,
covered in a morning haze, you are met
with a bizarre sight up ahead.
[Page]
There are large, silent shadows in
thick fog, shouldering a rainbow-
colored halo...
[Page]
The eerie shadows frighten you and sap
some of your enthusiasm for further
exploration.

Original: As you proceed down the animal trail,
covered in a morning haze, you are met
with a bizarre sight up ahead.
[Page]
There are large, silent shadows in
thick fog, shouldering a rainbow-
colored halo...
[Page]
But you know the shadows to be your
own, reflected in the mist.
[Page]
After taking a rest to look upon that
uncanny mirage, you take up your
journey again with renewed vigor.
Translation: As you proceed down the animal trail,
covered in a morning haze, you are met
with a bizarre sight up ahead.
[Page]
There are large, silent shadows in
thick fog, shouldering a rainbow-
colored halo...
[Page]
But you know the shadows to be your
own, reflected in the mist.
[Page]
After taking a rest to look upon that
uncanny mirage, you take up your
journey again with renewed vigor.

Original: [Color:3]The party recovers 15 TP.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]The party recovers 15 TP.[Color:0]

Original: You sense some presence nearby and
stop for a moment.
Translation: You sense some presence nearby and
stop for a moment.

Original: Looking around, you notice a
familiar, firefly-like light
floating in midair to the north.
[Page]
The light bobs and dances, and then
disappears without a sound.
[Page]
It looked as if it was showing you
which path to take... You decide to
resume your search.
Translation: Looking around, you notice a
familiar, firefly-like light
floating in midair to the north.
[Page]
The light bobs and dances, and then
disappears without a sound.
[Page]
It looked as if it was showing you
which path to take... You decide to
resume your search.

Original: You look about you to see a firefly-
like light floating to the east.
[Page]
The light capers and gambols, leaving
trails of light behind it. Eventually,
they disappear without a sound.
[Page]
What was it...? You decide to
continue your search.
Translation: You look about you to see a firefly-
like light floating to the east.
[Page]
The light capers and gambols, leaving
trails of light behind it. Eventually,
they disappear without a sound.
[Page]
What was it...? You decide to
continue your search.

Original: "You came! It's a delight to see all
your faces again," says the Medium
as she welcomes you.
[Page]
However, there is something sad in
her smile. Looking closer, you can
see the bags under her eyes.
[Page]
You broach the subject delicately,
to which she replies, "Yes... in
truth, I have not slept well lately."
[Page]
It seems that recently, her sleep has
been troubled by dreadful dreams of
which she remembers little.
[Page]
You offer to stay by her side while
she sleeps, but she shakes her head.
[Page]
"Though I do appreciate the offer,
I am worried... The [Color:5]night terrors[Color:0]
truly are horrific. I can tell..."
[Page]
Her expression becomes clouded.
She seems genuinely terrified of
what may happen.
Translation: "You came! It's a delight to see all
your faces again," says the Medium
as she welcomes you.
[Page]
However, there is something sad in
her smile. Looking closer, you can
see the bags under her eyes.
[Page]
You broach the subject delicately,
to which she replies, "Yes... in
truth, I have not slept well lately."
[Page]
It seems that recently, her sleep has
been troubled by dreadful dreams of
which she remembers little.
[Page]
You offer to stay by her side while
she sleeps, but she shakes her head.
[Page]
"Though I do appreciate the offer,
I am worried... The [Color:5]night terrors[Color:0]
truly are horrific. I can tell..."
[Page]
Her expression becomes clouded.
She seems genuinely terrified of
what may happen.

Original: [Color:5]Stand watch as she sleeps?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Stand watch as she sleeps?[Color:0]

Original: "No, I couldn't allow that..." She
hugs herself fearfully with those
small hands.
[Page]
"With my powers, I do not think it is
only a dream. [Color:5]Something terrible may
happen[Color:0]... You would still offer?"
[Page]
The Medium looks at you solemnly.
Translation: "No, I couldn't allow that..." She
hugs herself fearfully with those
small hands.
[Page]
"With my powers, I do not think it is
only a dream. [Color:5]Something terrible may
happen[Color:0]... You would still offer?"
[Page]
The Medium looks at you solemnly.

Original: [Color:5]Stay at her side anyway?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Stay at her side anyway?[Color:0]

Original: "You are all so kind. Thank you."
The Medium smiles weakly.
Translation: "You are all so kind. Thank you."
The Medium smiles weakly.

Original: She must have slept only fitfully
until now... As you watch over the
Medium, she quickly falls asleep.
[Page]
You can hear her soft breathing.
But then, something unusual begins
to take shape before you.
Translation: She must have slept only fitfully
until now... As you watch over the
Medium, she quickly falls asleep.
[Page]
You can hear her soft breathing.
But then, something unusual begins
to take shape before you.

Original: Just as the Medium's sleeping face
darkens, something like violet
lightning shines around her.
[Page]
The lightning strikes at you and
transports you away somewhere with
its intense power!
[Page]
When the blinding light subsides,
a terrible sight is before you...!
Translation: Just as the Medium's sleeping face
darkens, something like violet
lightning shines around her.
[Page]
The lightning strikes at you and
transports you away somewhere with
its intense power!
[Page]
When the blinding light subsides,
a terrible sight is before you...!

Original: Just as you think you have pierced
the Titan's core, you realize that
you are back in the Misty Ravine.
[Page]
It must have been a dream... but how
to account for the severe exhaustion
the whole party feels?
[Page]
It is exactly as if you truly did
fight the Titan. The Medium sleeps
soundly, her face again serene...
[Page]
It may be that by liberating her in
her dream, you have brought her peace
of mind again...
[Page]
"Thank you," the Medium mumbles
sleepily with a smile on her face.
Translation: Just as you think you have pierced
the Titan's core, you realize that
you are back in the Misty Ravine.
[Page]
It must have been a dream... but how
to account for the severe exhaustion
the whole party feels?
[Page]
It is exactly as if you truly did
fight the Titan. The Medium sleeps
soundly, her face again serene...
[Page]
It may be that by liberating her in
her dream, you have brought her peace
of mind again...
[Page]
"Thank you," the Medium mumbles
sleepily with a smile on her face.

Original: The Medium is fast asleep. It would
not do to disturb her for now...
Translation: The Medium is fast asleep. It would
not do to disturb her for now...

Original: "Welcome to Vessel Town. We last met
in the Cloudy Stronghold, wasn't it?"
The Medium smiles at you.
[Page]
"How is Baldur? Ah... I am glad to
hear it. I was worried for him. Let
us hope he recovers soon."
[Page]
"I believe there are changes in store
for Vessel Town and Tharsis, and I
look forward to what they may bring.
[Page]
"But it is you who gave us this
opportunity, and for that, I owe
you my thanks.
[Page]
"Thank you, Guild [Guild]."
Translation: "Welcome to Vessel Town. We last met
in the Cloudy Stronghold, wasn't it?"
The Medium smiles at you.
[Page]
"How is Baldur? Ah... I am glad to
hear it. I was worried for him. Let
us hope he recovers soon."
[Page]
"I believe there are changes in store
for Vessel Town and Tharsis, and I
look forward to what they may bring.
[Page]
"But it is you who gave us this
opportunity, and for that, I owe
you my thanks.
[Page]
"Thank you, Guild [Guild]."

Original: "I was telling the Vessel children
about Tharsis the other day. They all
said that they want to see it!"
[Page]
The Medium gives a shy smile before
continuing. "As do I... I would like
to walk its streets again with you."
Translation: "I was telling the Vessel children
about Tharsis the other day. They all
said that they want to see it!"
[Page]
The Medium gives a shy smile before
continuing. "As do I... I would like
to walk its streets again with you."

Original: "I received a letter recently from a
Sentinel child. It said that they are
all doing wonderfully!
[Page]
"The letter mentioned your guild,
too. You should visit them if you
ever have the time."
Translation: "I received a letter recently from a
Sentinel child. It said that they are
all doing wonderfully!
[Page]
"The letter mentioned your guild,
too. You should visit them if you
ever have the time."

Original: "Oh, listen to this! Envoys from the
Empire were here not long ago. Isn't
that amazing?
[Page]
"They asked about stories handed down
amongst the Vessels. Apparently they
are hungry for information.
[Page]
"There was even talk of a number of
them settling here in town! Oh, how
I hope it happens."
Translation: "Oh, listen to this! Envoys from the
Empire were here not long ago. Isn't
that amazing?
[Page]
"They asked about stories handed down
amongst the Vessels. Apparently they
are hungry for information.
[Page]
"There was even talk of a number of
them settling here in town! Oh, how
I hope it happens."

Original: "You are explorers... I wonder if
you'll eventually leave here in search
of new challenges," the Medium sighs.
[Page]
"It may not be long before you will
face bitter, hard times, somewhere
far away from here.
[Page]
"But if that happens, just think back
to the miracles you have given to all
of us here.
[Page]
"Don't forget about us. And come back
to us some day, won't you? I won't
forget you either..."
Translation: "You are explorers... I wonder if
you'll eventually leave here in search
of new challenges," the Medium sighs.
[Page]
"It may not be long before you will
face bitter, hard times, somewhere
far away from here.
[Page]
"But if that happens, just think back
to the miracles you have given to all
of us here.
[Page]
"Don't forget about us. And come back
to us some day, won't you? I won't
forget you either..."

Original: "Oh, you're here!" The Medium smiles
brightly and offers you a seat.
[Page]
"Everyone was so happy to see me
return. I'm ashamed to have thought
I was all alone as the only human.
[Page]
"I thought the Vessels had no choice
but to keep me here, since although
I am human, I am their Medium.
[Page]
"But that wasn't the case at all.
I think I should try harder to talk
with the Vessels from now on.
[Page]
"I'd like to talk with you more, too.
Please visit the Vessel Town when you
can, won't you?"
Translation: "Oh, you're here!" The Medium smiles
brightly and offers you a seat.
[Page]
"Everyone was so happy to see me
return. I'm ashamed to have thought
I was all alone as the only human.
[Page]
"I thought the Vessels had no choice
but to keep me here, since although
I am human, I am their Medium.
[Page]
"But that wasn't the case at all.
I think I should try harder to talk
with the Vessels from now on.
[Page]
"I'd like to talk with you more, too.
Please visit the Vessel Town when you
can, won't you?"

Original: "You plan to head north and meet with
Yggdrasil, right?
[Page]
"Yggdrasil is always asleep except for
when it talks to me. It's so cute...
it reminds me of a baby.
[Page]
"Even though it's been alive for much
longer than I have, and knows so
much. It's so mysterious..."
Translation: "You plan to head north and meet with
Yggdrasil, right?
[Page]
"Yggdrasil is always asleep except for
when it talks to me. It's so cute...
it reminds me of a baby.
[Page]
"Even though it's been alive for much
longer than I have, and knows so
much. It's so mysterious..."

Original: "At the elders' meeting, we decide on
our course of action. It has been so
since long before the Medium came.
[Page]
"Since the Medium is absent, I think
it's logical to abide by the decisions
made in the elders' meeting.
[Page]
"Wufan is too close to the Medium. It
is odd for a Vessel to be so attached.
Is this progress or regress...?"
Translation: "At the elders' meeting, we decide on
our course of action. It has been so
since long before the Medium came.
[Page]
"Since the Medium is absent, I think
it's logical to abide by the decisions
made in the elders' meeting.
[Page]
"Wufan is too close to the Medium. It
is odd for a Vessel to be so attached.
Is this progress or regress...?"

Original: "The human-shaped monsters called
'Hollows' are our enemies. They began
appearing after the Medium arrived.
[Page]
"There must be some connection between
the Medium and the Hollows... but it
is still unclear.
[Page]
"Strangely, the Hollows attack only
those who break our rules. Some here
in town call them the Executioners."
Translation: "The human-shaped monsters called
'Hollows' are our enemies. They began
appearing after the Medium arrived.
[Page]
"There must be some connection between
the Medium and the Hollows... but it
is still unclear.
[Page]
"Strangely, the Hollows attack only
those who break our rules. Some here
in town call them the Executioners."

Original: "The Medium has returned. Her smile
strikes me as more gentle than before.
[Page]
"It must be your doing. She must have
discovered her place in this town.
[Page]
"We thank you, humans. The Medium's
happiness is our happiness."
Translation: "The Medium has returned. Her smile
strikes me as more gentle than before.
[Page]
"It must be your doing. She must have
discovered her place in this town.
[Page]
"We thank you, humans. The Medium's
happiness is our happiness."

Original: "The Medium has departed with the
human named Whirlwind.
[Page]
"It is awkward to tell you this, but
our lingering distrust of humans
makes us suspicious of that man.
[Page]
"But the Medium's will must be done.
All we can do now is pray for her
safety."
Translation: "The Medium has departed with the
human named Whirlwind.
[Page]
"It is awkward to tell you this, but
our lingering distrust of humans
makes us suspicious of that man.
[Page]
"But the Medium's will must be done.
All we can do now is pray for her
safety."

Original: "When Wufan grew angry before, she
denounced us, saying that we neglected
the Medium. But this was not so.
[Page]
"We must follow the correct course of
action. To do that, we must know: why
did the Hollows kidnap the Medium?
[Page]
"The Hollows do not come here unless
something drastic happens. Perhaps
something lured them to us...?"
Translation: "When Wufan grew angry before, she
denounced us, saying that we neglected
the Medium. But this was not so.
[Page]
"We must follow the correct course of
action. To do that, we must know: why
did the Hollows kidnap the Medium?
[Page]
"The Hollows do not come here unless
something drastic happens. Perhaps
something lured them to us...?"

Original: "So the Medium is kidnapped. We had
thought this Whirlwind was an enigma,
but now we know his nature.
[Page]
"We bear no grudge against you for it.
Humans have much stronger individual
wills than we Vessels.
[Page]
"But humans must be responsible for
their own. A human criminal must be
judged by other humans.
[Page]
"Though of course, we will have our
say in the matter."
Translation: "So the Medium is kidnapped. We had
thought this Whirlwind was an enigma,
but now we know his nature.
[Page]
"We bear no grudge against you for it.
Humans have much stronger individual
wills than we Vessels.
[Page]
"But humans must be responsible for
their own. A human criminal must be
judged by other humans.
[Page]
"Though of course, we will have our
say in the matter."

Original: "The Medium was born from a sacred
relic deep in this forest. It was in
the hall where the Hollows now dwell.
[Page]
"Over ten years ago, a Vessel who went
to clean that hall came back in a
hurry, carrying a human child.
[Page]
"That child was the Medium, and the
Vessel who found her was Wufan. She
has taken care of the Medium since."
Translation: "The Medium was born from a sacred
relic deep in this forest. It was in
the hall where the Hollows now dwell.
[Page]
"Over ten years ago, a Vessel who went
to clean that hall came back in a
hurry, carrying a human child.
[Page]
"That child was the Medium, and the
Vessel who found her was Wufan. She
has taken care of the Medium since."

Original: "I have seen Yggdrasil collapse with
my own eyes. To my shame as a Vessel,
I feel anger towards humans now.
[Page]
"Yggdrasil was a source of spiritual
support and the reason we exist. I
hate the humans who have stolen it.
[Page]
"And as a result, I understand. Hatred
gives way to destruction. To think
humans harbored that monstrosity..."
Translation: "I have seen Yggdrasil collapse with
my own eyes. To my shame as a Vessel,
I feel anger towards humans now.
[Page]
"Yggdrasil was a source of spiritual
support and the reason we exist. I
hate the humans who have stolen it.
[Page]
"And as a result, I understand. Hatred
gives way to destruction. To think
humans harbored that monstrosity..."

Original: "I sense pain... it is very strong.
This is the Medium's pain.
[Page]
"She is saddened at how her own kind,
whom she has come to know, has so
utterly changed...
[Page]
"This pain will not be stopped by
bringing the Medium back. How can
we end such pain?"
Translation: "I sense pain... it is very strong.
This is the Medium's pain.
[Page]
"She is saddened at how her own kind,
whom she has come to know, has so
utterly changed...
[Page]
"This pain will not be stopped by
bringing the Medium back. How can
we end such pain?"

Original: "The legendary Titan has shown itself.
It is what the Vessels and Sentinels
once banded together to defeat.
[Page]
"The Medium is trying to calm the
Titan. If she were not, the Titan's
power would have already changed us.
[Page]
"We do not intend to show the Titan
our backs. We will wrest the Medium
from it and carry out her will."
Translation: "The legendary Titan has shown itself.
It is what the Vessels and Sentinels
once banded together to defeat.
[Page]
"The Medium is trying to calm the
Titan. If she were not, the Titan's
power would have already changed us.
[Page]
"We do not intend to show the Titan
our backs. We will wrest the Medium
from it and carry out her will."

Original: "Why did we save the Imperial Prince?
That is a difficult question.
Obviously, the Medium wished it so...
[Page]
"But I feel that what we saved was
not merely the Imperial Prince, but
humanity as a whole.
[Page]
"There was no logical reason. Perhaps
the blood that shaped us guided our
hand in doing so."
Translation: "Why did we save the Imperial Prince?
That is a difficult question.
Obviously, the Medium wished it so...
[Page]
"But I feel that what we saved was
not merely the Imperial Prince, but
humanity as a whole.
[Page]
"There was no logical reason. Perhaps
the blood that shaped us guided our
hand in doing so."

Original: "Our town has seen great changes since
you came. The greatest of them is the
way the Medium smiles more now...
[Page]
"Perhaps some good has come of this.
I have heard you explorers have a
guild. Does this guild have a name?
[Page]
"So it is called Guild [Guild].
I see. It is written in my heart
now. I vow never to forget it."
Translation: "Our town has seen great changes since
you came. The greatest of them is the
way the Medium smiles more now...
[Page]
"Perhaps some good has come of this.
I have heard you explorers have a
guild. Does this guild have a name?
[Page]
"So it is called Guild [Guild].
I see. It is written in my heart
now. I vow never to forget it."
